sub_title: Data Scientist at Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI)
summary: Following a PhD in mathematics at the University of Melbourne, my research focuses on machine learning methods and artificial intelligence. The developed methods and applications have been published in a broad range of journals, covering computer vision, atmospheric science, transportation, urban design and financial mathematics.

publications.name: The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on air pollution: A global assessment using machine learning techniques

authors.headline: Data Scientist at Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI)

profile_positions.description: Research and Development position with a particular focus on artificial intelligence and machine learning methods. Jasper is part of the KNMI DataLab, performing data-driven research using new and existing data sources in relation to weather forecasting and climate research.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description: Post-doc position focussing on artificial intelligence methods and applications, including convolutional neural networks, generative adversarial networks, variational autoencoders and Long Short-Term Memory recurrent neural networks. Jasper was part of the cross-disciplinary Transport, Health and Urban Design Research Lab at the University of Melbourne, Australia’s highest ranked university (global ranking: #31).
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow

profile_positions.location: The Netherlands, Switzerland (1 year), United States (1 year)
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor
